column4: I just removed the /etc/postgresql conf because I wanted to restore the default,  and I uninstalled postgresql and re-installed it,  but now it's not re-creating the /etc/postgresql dir?
did you purge it?
yes, I did apt-get remove --purge postgresql
any ideas?  I can't seem to figure out how to get the missing conf files back
not sure yet, trying to find out

figured it out, sudo apt-get purge postgresql postgresql-8.3 postgresql-common; sudo rm -rf /etc/postgresql /etc/postgresql-common; then sudo apt-get install postgresql; that regenerated all the config for me
looks like the only mention of /etc/postgresql/ is in the postrm file?
yeah, I don't know, it is strange
Ubuntu Software Center/Edit/Software Sources...
probably need zlib1g-dev (although PIL is in the repos, python-imaging package)
I'm installing PIL within a virtualenv,  which is why I need the dev packages.  I have zlib1g-dev installed.  Any ideas why it wouldn't be working?
this is ubuntu Natty, btw
if you pastebin the output with the errors, I'll take a look, but otherwise I don't know
you could also try: sudo apt-get build-dep python-imaging;
although probably gets you more than you need
http://pastie.org/2899033
I have setup_site.py in the virtualenv's site-packages directory,  which has the following contents:  http://pastie.org/2899037
also, the file  /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libz.so   exists.
you should probably mention you're installing it with pip, since zlib1g-dev is the correct package, so the problem is actually that pip isn't finding it it seems
there is a thread about it in the forums, couple workarounds: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1751455
found a project called "Pillow" which is a fork of PIP.  That seemed to work better.

glad you found a workaround. If you find you need PIL later, get the python-imaging source and debian/patches/01_multiarch_support.patch should be the fix you need to build zlib support (I should have looked closer earlier)
